      • toUnformattedString

        public java.lang.String toUnformattedString()
        Returns text without decoration characters. Method works with respect to all the mask parameters. Just as toString() does;



        Example: assume that filled mask contains "+7 999 111-22-33" where spaces and dashes are decoration slots. Then this method will return "+79991112233".

        Specified by:
        toUnformattedString in interface Mask
        Returns:
        content of the mask without characters in a decoration slots.

        public boolean hasUserInput()

        Specified by:

      • insertAt

        public int insertAt(int position,
                    java.lang.CharSequence input,
                    boolean cursorAfterTrailingHardcoded)
        Method insert input to the buffer. Only validated characters would be inserted. Hardcoded slots are omitted. Method returns new cursor position that is affected by input and cursorAfterTrailingHardcoded flag. In most cases if input string is followed by a sequence of hardcoded characters we should place cursor after them. But this behaviour can be modified by cursorAfterTrailingHardcoded flag.
        Specified by:
        insertAt in interface Mask
        Parameters:
        position - from which position to begin input
        input - string to insert
        cursorAfterTrailingHardcoded - when input is followed by a hardcoded characters sequence then this flag defines whether new cursor position should be after or before them
        Returns:
        cursor position after insert

      • insertAt

        public int insertAt(int position,
                    java.lang.CharSequence input)
        Convenience method for insertAt(int, CharSequence, boolean) that always places cursor after trailing hardcoded sequence.
        Specified by:
        insertAt in interface Mask
        Parameters:
        position - from which position to begin input
        input - string to insert
        Returns:
        cursor position after insert

      • insertFront

        public int insertFront(java.lang.CharSequence input)
        Convenience method for insertAt(int, CharSequence, boolean) that inserts text at the first position of a mask and always places cursor after trailing hardcoded sequence.
        Specified by:

      • removeBackwards

        public int removeBackwards(int position,
                           int count)
        Removes available symbols from the buffer. This method should be called on deletion event of user's input. Symbols are deleting backwards (just as backspace key). Hardcoded symbols would not be deleted, only cursor will be moved over them.

        Method also updates showHardcodedTail flag that defines whether tail of hardcoded symbols (at the end of user's input) should be shown. In most cases it should not. The only case when they are visible - buffer starts with them and deletion was inside them.

        Specified by:
        removeBackwards in interface Mask
        Parameters:
        position - from where to start deletion
        count - number of symbols to delete.
        Returns:
        new cursor position after deletion

      • removeBackwardsWithoutHardcoded

                                           int count)
        Specified by:
        removeBackwardsWithoutHardcoded in interface Mask

      • setHideHardcodedHead

        public void setHideHardcodedHead(boolean shouldHideHardcodedHead)
        Description copied from interface: Mask
        Defines whether mask should hide leading hardcoded sequence when calling #toString() or Mask.toUnformattedString().

        Example of "hardcoded head" is +7 ( in the russian cellphone number mask defined in PredefinedSlots.RUS_PHONE_NUMBER.
        Specified by:
        setHideHardcodedHead in interface Mask
        Parameters:
        shouldHideHardcodedHead - the "hide hardcode head" value

      • isForbidInputWhenFilled

        public boolean isForbidInputWhenFilled()
        Specified by:
        isForbidInputWhenFilled in interface Mask
        Returns:
        true if mask won't allow to perform further input if all the slots are already filled out.

        See: Mask.setForbidInputWhenFilled(boolean)

      • setForbidInputWhenFilled

        public void setForbidInputWhenFilled(boolean forbidInputWhenFilled)
        Description copied from interface: Mask
        Defines whether mask won't allow to perform further input if all the slots are already filled out. If false passed - mask will shift existing input when trying to insert text inside filled out mask (Mask.filled() returns true).

        WARNING: This flag only makes sense for terminated masks.
        Specified by:
        setForbidInputWhenFilled in interface Mask
        Parameters:
        forbidInputWhenFilled - flag that forbids overwriting terminated filled out masks.
